author: Cortex XSIAM

incidentfield.description: Classification used to map identity type that initiated an operation which triggered an alert. For example, Service, Application and Temporary Credentials
incidentfield.name: Cloud Identity Type

incidentfield.description: The SHA256 hash value of the initiator.
incidentfield.name: Initiator SHA256

incidentfield.description: Parent operating system signer
incidentfield.name: OS Parent Signer

incidentfield.description: For XDR Agent alerts, this field identifies the protection module that triggered the alert.
incidentfield.name: Module

incidentfield.description: OS parent thread ID.
incidentfield.name: OS Parent ID

incidentfield.description: SHA256 hash value of an Microsoft Office file macro
incidentfield.name: File Macro SHA256

incidentfield.description: Command-line used to initiate the process including any arguments.
incidentfield.name: Initiator CMD

incidentfield.description: If the alert triggered on network activity (the Event Type is Network Connection) this is the the remote host name that triggered the alert. If not, then N/A.
incidentfield.name: Remote Host

incidentfield.description: The ID that matches the rule that triggered the alert
incidentfield.name: Rule ID

incidentfield.description: The firewall rule name that matches the network traffic that triggered the firewall alert.
incidentfield.name: FW Rule Name

incidentfield.description: A more specific classification used to map the types of resources. For example, DISK,VPC, Subnet are all mapped to Compute
incidentfield.name: Cloud Resource Sub-type

incidentfield.description: Signer of the process that triggered the alert.
incidentfield.name: Initiator signer

incidentfield.description: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the Windows endpoint or server on which this alert triggered.
incidentfield.name: Host FQDN

incidentfield.description: The firewall rule ID that triggered the firewall alert
incidentfield.name: XFF

incidentfield.description: Parent operating system SHA256 hash value
incidentfield.name: OS Parent SHA256

incidentfield.description: The email recipient value of a firewall alerts triggered on a the content of a malicious email.
incidentfield.name: Email Recipient

incidentfield.description: The date and time when the alert was triggered. Right-click to Show rows 30 days prior or 30 days after the selected timestamp field value
incidentfield.name: Timestamp

incidentfield.description: The domain on which an alert was triggered.
incidentfield.name: Domain

incidentfield.description: Represents the resources that are referenced in the alert log. In most cases, the referred resource will be where the operation was initiated on
incidentfield.name: Cloud Referenced Resource

incidentfield.description: SHA256 hash value of the file.
incidentfield.name: File SHA256

incidentfield.description: Miscellaneous information about the alert.
incidentfield.name: Misc

incidentfield.description: The name of the cloud provider where the alert occurred: AWS/GCP/Azure/etc
incidentfield.name: Cloud Provider

incidentfield.description: The source zone name of the connection for firewall alerts.
incidentfield.name: Source Zone Name

incidentfield.description: Action taken by the alert sensor, either Detected or Prevented with action status displayed in parenthesis.
incidentfield.name: Host OS

incidentfield.description: The destination zone of the connection for firewall alerts.
incidentfield.name: Destination Zone Name

incidentfield.description: The URL destination address of the domain triggering the firewall alert.
incidentfield.name: URL

incidentfield.description: When the alert triggered on a file (the Event Type is File) this is the path to the file on the endpoint. If not, then N/A.
incidentfield.name: File path

incidentfield.description: Signing status of the operating system of the activity
incidentfield.name: OS Parent Signature

incidentfield.description: APP-ID category name associated with a firewall alert
incidentfield.name: App Category

incidentfield.description: The name of the process that initiated an activity such as a network connection or registry change.
incidentfield.name: Initiated By

incidentfield.description: Displays the type of MITRE ATT&CK technique and sub-technique on which the alert was triggered.
incidentfield.name: Mitre ATT&CK Technique

incidentfield.description: Related App-ID for an alert. App-ID is a traffic classification system that determines what an application is irrespective of port, protocol, encryption (SSH or SSL) or any other evasive tactic used by the application. When known, you can also pivot to the Palo Alto Networks Applipedia entry that describes the detected application.
incidentfield.name: App-id

incidentfield.description: MAC address of the endpoint or server on which this alert triggered.
incidentfield.name: Host Mac Address

incidentfield.description: The MD5 value of the CGO that initiated the alert.
incidentfield.name: CGO MD5

incidentfield.description: Thread ID (TID) of the initiating process.
incidentfield.name: Initiator TID

incidentfield.description: A more specific classification of the identity initiated operation. For example, for Identity Type: Temporary Credentials the sub type could be Assumed Role
incidentfield.name: Cloud Identity Sub Type

incidentfield.description: IP address of the endpoint or server on which this alert triggered.
incidentfield.name: Host IP

incidentfield.description: Displays the type of MITRE ATT&CK tactic on which the alert was triggered.
incidentfield.name: Mitre ATT&CK Tactic

incidentfield.description: MD5 hash value of the file.
incidentfield.name: File MD5

incidentfield.description: If the alert triggered on registry modifications (the Event Type is Registry) this is the full registry key that triggered the alert. If not, then N/A.
incidentfield.name: Registry Full Key

incidentfield.description: Command-line used to by the parent operating system to initiate the process including any arguments
incidentfield.name: OS Parent CMD

incidentfield.description: Signing status of the CGO: Unsigned, Signed, Invalid Signature, Unknown.
incidentfield.name: CGO signature

incidentfield.description: The MD5 value of the process which initiated the alert.
incidentfield.name: Initiator MD5

incidentfield.description: Signer of the process that triggered the alert.
incidentfield.name: Process execution signer

incidentfield.description: The type of event on which the alert was triggered: File Event, Injection Event, Load Image Event, Network Event, Process Execution, Registry Event
incidentfield.name: Event Type

incidentfield.description: The domain name queried in the DNS request.
incidentfield.name: DNS Query Name

incidentfield.description: Indicates whether a firewall alert is classified as phishing
incidentfield.name: Is Phishing

incidentfield.description: The SHA256 value of the CGO that initiated the alert.
incidentfield.name: CGO SHA256

incidentfield.description: Command-line arguments of the Causality Group Owner.
incidentfield.name: CGO CMD

incidentfield.description: The serial number of the firewall that raised the firewall alert.
incidentfield.name: FW Serial Number

incidentfield.description: The hostname of the endpoint or server on which this alert triggered. The hostname is generally available for XDR agent alerts or alerts that are stitched with EDR data. When the hostname is unknown, this field is blank.
incidentfield.name: Hostname

incidentfield.description: The name of the process that started the causality chain based on Cortex XDR causality logic.
incidentfield.name: CGO name

incidentfield.description: Represents the cloud provider folders or projects. For example, AWS Accounts and Azure Subscriptions
incidentfield.name: Cloud Project

incidentfield.description: If the alert triggered on network activity (the Event Type is Network Connection) this is the IP address of the host that triggered the alert. If not, then N/A.
incidentfield.name: Local IP

incidentfield.description: The command-line of the process whose creation triggered the alert.
incidentfield.name: Target process CMD

incidentfield.description: The remote IP address of a network operation that triggered the alert.
incidentfield.name: Remote IP

incidentfield.description: Whether the alert is excluded by an exclusion configuration
incidentfield.name: Excluded

incidentfield.description: The operating system subtype of the agent from which the alert was triggered.
incidentfield.name: Agent OS Sub Type

incidentfield.description: A unique identifier per agent.
incidentfield.name: Agent Id

incidentfield.description: Action taken by the alert sensor, either Detected or Prevented with action status displayed in parenthesis.
incidentfield.name: Action

incidentfield.description: Path of the initiating process.
incidentfield.name: Initiator path

incidentfield.description: Classifications used to map similar types of resources across different cloud providers. For example, EC2, Google Compute Engine, and Microsoft Compute are all mapped to Compute
incidentfield.name: Cloud Resource Type

incidentfield.description: Name of the virtual system for the Palo Alto Networks firewall that triggered an alert
incidentfield.name: NGFW Vsys Name

incidentfield.description: APP-ID technology name associated with a firewall alert
incidentfield.name: App Technology

incidentfield.description: OS parent process ID
incidentfield.name: OS Parent PID

incidentfield.description: The email sender value of a firewall alerts triggered on a the content of a malicious email.
incidentfield.name: Email Sender

incidentfield.description: Signing status of the process that initiated the activity: Unsigned, Signed, Invalid Signature, Unknown.
incidentfield.name: Initiator signature

incidentfield.description: The firewall rule ID that triggered the firewall alert
incidentfield.name: FW Rule ID

incidentfield.description: The email subject value of a firewall alerts triggered on a the content of a malicious email.
incidentfield.name: Email Subject

incidentfield.description: Alert category based on the alert source. An example of an XDR Agent alert category is Exploit Modules.
incidentfield.name: Category Name

incidentfield.description: The remote port of a network operation that triggered the alert.
incidentfield.name: Remote Port

incidentfield.description: Name of the user associated with the parent operating system
incidentfield.name: OS Parent User Name

incidentfield.description: If the alert triggered on registry modifications (the Event Type is Registry) this is the registry data that triggered the alert. If not, then N/A
incidentfield.name: Registry Data

incidentfield.description: The SHA256 hash vale of an external DLL file that triggered the alert.
incidentfield.name: Target process SHA256

incidentfield.description: The name of the software publishing vendor that signed the file in the causality chain that led up to the alert.
incidentfield.name: CGO signer

incidentfield.description: The name of the user that initiated the behavior that triggered the alert. If the user is a domain user account, this field also identifies the domain. Any alert triggered based on network, authentication, or login events, displays the User Name in the follow standardized format in the Alerts and Incidents pages.<company domain>\<username>
incidentfield.name: User name

incidentfield.description: Unique identifier of the causality instance generated by Cortex XDR
incidentfield.name: CID

incidentfield.description: Process ID (PID) of the initiating process.
incidentfield.name: Initiator PID

incidentfield.description: Whether the alert is starred by starring configuration
incidentfield.name: Starred

incidentfield.description: If the alert triggered on network activity (the Event Type is Network Connection) this is the port on the endpoint that triggered the alert. If not, then N/A.
incidentfield.name: Local Port

incidentfield.description: APP-ID Sub category name associated with a firewall alert
incidentfield.name: appsubcategory

incidentfield.description: Signature status of the process that triggered the alert: Unsigned, Signed, Invalid Signature, Unknown.
incidentfield.name: Process execution signature

incidentfield.description: Name of firewall on which a firewall alert was raised.
incidentfield.name: FW Name

incidentfield.description: The name of the process whose creation triggered the alert.
incidentfield.name: Target process name

description: This Content Pack will provide you with the core alert fields.
name: Core Alert Fields
